attributes.action: No further rent payment from students living in university halls.
attributes.additional_details:
The desicion made by universities to move every aspect of university academia to online teaching was encouraged by the government. Most students will be leaving halls as it's safer to stay with family or carers as support will be provided if anyone was to catch COVID-19.
Taking into account that the majority of First Year students live in halls of residence, a heightened risk of exposure to COVID-19 remains. It is therefore practical and sensible for students to move out of halls.
attributes.background: Due to the closing of universities, all residential hall payments for rent from the date of university closure to the end of contact date should be suspended. Although it has not been made compulsory to leave, there is no reason for students to remain in halls if they are unable to attend lectures.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because suspending payments for rent is a matter for individual landlords, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

If you want the Government to encourage lenders, landlords and utilities to freeze payments during lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302256

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
